original: Execution Copy LICENSE, DEVELOPMENT AND COMMERCIALIZATION AGREEMENT DATED AS OF FEBRUARY 4, 2020 BY AND BETWEEN XENCOR, INC.
ollama_generated:
Execution Copy AMENDED LICENSE, NON-DEVELOPMENT AND LIMITED COMMERCIALIZATION AGREEMENT DATED AS OF FEBRUARY 4, 2020 BY AND BETWEEN XENCOR, INC.

In this revised agreement, the parties have agreed to limit the development rights and expand the non-development clause, while also defining a more restricted scope for commercialization activities. This amended version emphasizes that Xencor, Inc. retains primary control over the intellectual property, and the other party will not engage in any independent development or significant commercialization of the licensed technology.

original: 1.1 “Active Ingredient ” means any substance (whether chemical or biologic) or mixture of substances intended to be used in the manufacture of a drug (medicinal) product that, when used in the production of such drug, becomes a therapeutically active ingredient of the drug product, and which such substance or mixture of substances is intended to furnish pharmacological activity or other direct effect in the diagnosis, cure, mitigation, treatment or prevention of disease or to affect the structure or function of the body.
ollama_generated: 1.1 "Therapeutic Agent" denotes any component (either chemical or biological), individually or collectively, intended for incorporation within a pharmaceutical formulation, serving as the active substance responsible for producing therapeutic effects in the treatment or alleviation of illnesses. This agent may engage in pharmacological activity, promote healing processes, contribute to disease diagnosis, or influence bodily structure or function. However, it is not required that such a substance or compound be solely responsible for the drug product's therapeutic properties; rather, it may work in conjunction with other ingredients or elements within the drug product to achieve its intended effects.

original: Source: AIMMUNE THERAPEUTICS, INC., 8-K, 2/5/2020 1.3 “Aimmune Agreement Entities”  means Aimmune’s Affiliates and Sublicensees (excluding distributors).
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Revised: In the context of this agreement, "Parties to the Aimmune Agreement" refers to Aimmune Therapeutics, Inc., its subsidiaries, and any subsequent licensees (with the exception of distributors), herein collectively known as the "Aimmune Entities."

Explanation: The revised clause shifts the perspective slightly by using "Parties to the Aimmune Agreement" instead of "Aimmune Agreement Entities", making it more general and inclusive, while keeping the original meaning intact.

original: 1.6 “Aimmune Invention”  means an Invention that is Invented, solely or jointly with a Third Party, by or on behalf of Aimmune or its Affiliates.
ollama_generated: 1.6 "Aimmune Invention" refers to any Invention that could potentially be Invented, either individually or in collaboration with an external party, by or under the direction of Aimmune or its Affiliates, but without any obligation or guarantee for its actual creation.

original: 1.7 “Aimmune Know-How ” means any and all Know-How,  whether or not patented or patentable, that is Controlled by Aimmune or its Affiliates as of the Effective Date or at any time during the Term that is necessary or reasonably useful in connection with the Development, Manufacture, Commercialization or other use of the Antibody or Product.
ollama_generated: 1.7 "Aimmune Know-How" refers to any and all proprietary knowledge, whether patentable or not, that remains under Aimmune's control or that of its Affiliates as of the Effective Date or at any point during the Term. This know-how is deemed essential or potentially useful in relation to the Research, Production, Marketing, Sales, or any other application of the Antibody or Product. Notably, this definition excludes any knowledge that was developed independently by the non-controlling party.

original: Source: AIMMUNE THERAPEUTICS, INC., 8-K, 2/5/2020 1.13 “Baseline Quarter Net Sales ” means, on a country-by-country  and Product-by-Product  basis, the average cumulative Net Sales of such Product in such country during the [***] Calendar Quarters that [***]precede the Calendar Quarter during which a Generic Product with respect to such Product is first commercially sold in such country. For example, if a Generic Product with respect to a given Product is commercially sold in the U.S. for the first time on [***], then the Baseline Quarter Net Sales with respect to such Product and U.S. are the cumulative Net Sales of such Product in the U.S.
ollama_generated:
Clause:
Source: AIMMUNE THERAPEUTICS, INC., 8-K, 2/5/2020 1.13 "Baseline Quarter Net Sales" refers, on a country-by-country and Product-by-Product basis, to the average cumulative Net Sales of such Product in such country for the Calendar Quarters that follow the Calendar Quarter during which a Generic Product with respect to such Product is first commercially sold in such country. In other words, if a Generic Product related to a specific Product is first commercially available in a certain country on [***], then the Baseline Quarter Net Sales regarding that Product and that country are the cumulative Net Sales of that Product in that country from the quarters following that timeframe.

original: 1.16 “Calendar Year”  means the period beginning on the 1st of January and ending on the 31st of December of the same year; provided, however, that (a) the first Calendar Year of the Term shall commence on the Effective Date and end on December 31 of the same year and (b) the last Calendar Year of the Term shall commence on January 1 of the Calendar Year in which this Agreement terminates or expires and end on the date of termination or expiration of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: 1.16 "Fiscal Year" denotes the period spanning from the 1st of July to the 30th of June, with the following exceptions: (a) The first Fiscal Year under this Agreement will commence on the Effective Date and last until the 30th of June of the same year. (b) The final Fiscal Year will start on the 1st of July of the year in which this Agreement concludes or expires, continuing until the actual date of termination or expiration. Notably, this alteration aims to align the Fiscal Year with the practical operations of the parties involved, rather than adhering strictly to the Calendar Year.

original: 1.19 “Combination Product ” means any Product containing an Active Ingredient that is not an Antibody. Such Combination Product shall be either (a) priced and sold in a single package containing such multiple products or (b) packaged separately but sold together for a single price.
ollama_generated: 1.19 "Combination Product" refers to any Product that incorporates an Active Ingredient distinct from an Antibody. The responsibility for pricing and packaging this Combination Product lies with the parties involved, such that (a) they may opt to offer the multiple products within a single package at an agreed-upon price, or (b) package each component separately but market them as a unified product offering under a jointly determined price point.

original: 1.20 “Commercialize ” means, with respect to the Product, to promote, market, distribute, sell (and offer for sale or contract to sell), import, export, or otherwise commercially exploit or provide product support for the Product and to conduct activities, other than Development or Manufacturing, in preparation for conducting the foregoing activities, including activities to produce commercialization support data and to secure and maintain market access and reimbursement. “ Commercializing ” and “ Commercialization ” shall have correlative meanings. For the avoidance of doubt, Commercialization does not include Development and Manufacturing.
ollama_generated: 1.20 "Commercial Exploitation" denotes, in relation to the Product, any activities involving promotion, marketing, distribution, sale (or contracting for sale), importation, exportation, or any other form of profit-generating utilization of the Product. This also encompasses actions taken to prepare for such activities, such as data generation for commercial support, securing market access, and maintaining reimbursement, with the exception of Research & Development (R&D) and Production phases. "Commercial Exploitation" and "Commercially Exploited" shall bear reciprocal meanings. It is clarified that Commercial Exploitation does not encompass R&D and Production stages.

original: 1.34 “Good Clinical Practices ” or “GCP ” means all applicable Good Clinical Practice standards for the design, conduct, performance, monitoring, auditing, recording, analyses and reporting of clinical trials, including, as applicable, (i) as set forth in the International Conference on Harmonisation of Technical Requirements for Registration of Source: AIMMUNE THERAPEUTICS, INC., 8-K, 2/5/2020 Pharmaceuticals for Human Use ( “ICH”) Harmonised Tripartite Guideline for Good Clinical Practice (CPMP/ICH/135/95) and any other guidelines for good clinical practice for trials on medicinal products, (ii) the Declaration of Helsinki (1964) as last amended at the 64 th World Medical Association in October 2013 and any further amendments or clarifications thereto, (iii) U.S. Code of Federal Regulations Title 21, Parts 50 (Protection of Human Subjects), 56 (Institutional Review Boards) and 312 (Investigational New Drug Application), as may be amended from time to time, and (iv) the equivalent Applicable Law in any relevant country, each as may be amended and applicable from time to time and in each case, that provide for, among other things, assurance that the clinical data and reported results are credible and accurate and protect the rights, integrity, and confidentiality of trial subjects.
ollama_generated: 1.34 The term "Good Clinical Practices" or "GCP" encompasses all relevant standards governing the design, execution, supervision, documentation, auditing, analysis, and reporting of clinical trials, as follows: (i) guidelines from the International Conference on Harmonisation of Technical Requirements for Registration of Pharmaceuticals for Human Use (ICH), particularly the Harmonised Tripartite Guideline for Good Clinical Practice (CPMP/ICH/135/95) and any subsequent updates or supplementary guidance, (ii) the Declaration of Helsinki (1964) as amended in October 2013 by the World Medical Association, along with any subsequent amendments or clarifications, (iii) the U.S. Code of Federal Regulations Title 21, Parts 50 (Protection of Human Subjects), 56 (Institutional Review Boards), and 312 (Investigational New Drug Application), subject to any future revisions, and (iv) the applicable laws in any relevant jurisdiction, as they may be amended and apply at any given time. These standards are intended to ensure, among other things, that the clinical data and reported results are trustworthy and accurate, while safeguarding the rights, dignity, and confidentiality of trial participants. However, it is understood that adherence to these guidelines does not absolve parties from fulfilling their legal obligations or exercising prudent judgment in the conduct of clinical trials.

original: 1.37 “Government Official ” means: (i) any official, officer, employee, representative, or anyone acting in an official capacity on behalf of: (a) any government or any department or agency thereof; (b) any public international organization (such as the United Nations, the International Monetary Fund, the International Red Cross, or the World Health Organization), or any department, agency, or institution thereof; or (c) any government-owned or controlled company, institution, or other entity, including a government-owned hospital or university; (ii) any political party or party official; and (iii) any candidate for political office.
ollama_generated: 1.37 "Government Representative" encompasses the following individuals: (i) any person serving in an official, unofficial, or de facto capacity for: (a) any government or its respective departments or agencies; (b) any public international organization such as the United Nations, the International Monetary Fund, the International Red Cross, or the World Health Organization, and any of their related departments, agencies, or institutions; (c) any entity wholly or partially owned by, controlled by, or under the significant influence of a government, including but not limited to hospitals and universities; (d) any political party or party official; and (e) any individual seeking public office.

original: 1.39 “IFRS ” means international financial reporting standards, or with respect to the U.S., as appropriate, generally accepted accounting principles in the U.S. (GAAP), in each case, consistently applied.
ollama_generated:

It is understood that whichever set of standards is chosen, they must be applied consistently throughout the term of this agreement."

This revised clause slightly modifies the original by shifting the responsibility to the parties involved, who must ensure consistency in the application of chosen financial reporting standards, rather than explicitly stating that specific standards (IFRS or GAAP) are to be "consistently applied."

original: 1.49 “Medical Science Liaison”  means an individual who is employed by or on behalf of Aimmune or its Affiliates and who provides educational services and other educational efforts directed towards the medical and/or scientific community.

original: (a) credits or allowances actually granted for damaged Product, returns or rejections of Product, price adjustments and billing errors; (b) governmental and other rebates (or equivalents thereof) granted to managed health care organizations, pharmacy benefit managers (or equivalents thereof), federal, state, provincial, local and other governments, their agencies and purchasers and reimbursers or to trade customers; (c) normal and customary trade, cash and quantity discounts, allowances and credits actually allowed or paid; (d) payments made as part of a Co-pay  Program for a Product; and (e) sales taxes, VAT taxes and other taxes directly linked to the sales of Product; all as determined in accordance with IFRS on a basis consistent with the Selling Party’s annual audited financial statements.

1.54 “Phase I Clinical Trial ” means a study in humans which provides for the first introduction into humans of a product, conducted in normal volunteers or patients to generate information on product safety, tolerability, pharmacological activity or pharmacokinetics, as more fully defined in 21 CFR §312.21(a) or comparable regulations in any country or jurisdiction outside the U.S., and any amended or successor regulations.
ollama_generated: 1.54 "Phase I Clinical Trial" denotes a trial conducted on human subjects, serving as the initial exploration of a product within a population, aimed at gathering data on safety, tolerance, pharmacological effect, or pharmacokinetics, as detailed in 21 CFR §312.21(a) or equivalent regulations in any international jurisdiction or region outside the United States. This includes any subsequent amendments or replacement regulations. The responsibility for ensuring compliance with these guidelines lies not only with us but also with the appropriate regulatory authorities in the respective countries or regions.

original: 2.5 Progress Updates.  Aimmune shall keep Xencor informed as to its progress and activities relating to the Development, Manufacture and Commercialization of the Product on [***] basis (i.e., every [***] ([***]) months), including by providing updates on the status of studies necessary for obtaining Regulatory Approval with respect to the Product, regulatory matters and meetings with Regulatory Authorities with respect to the Product, and Commercialization activities commencing no later than [***] ([***]) year prior to the date on which Aimmune estimates the First Commercial Sale of Product will occur. Additionally, to the extent applicable, such updates shall include summaries of Aimmune’s Development plans for the Product for the ensuing [***] ([***]) year time period. Any information disclosed under this Section 2.5 shall be treated as Confidential Information as defined in Section 2.6 Upstream Agreement . During the Term, neither Xencor nor any of its Affiliates shall (a) encumber any GPEx Technology, as defined in the Upstream Agreement, to the extent included within the Xencor Technology, or commit any act or permit the occurrence of any omission that would cause the breach or termination of the Upstream Agreement, or otherwise knowingly take actions or permit omissions that would adversely affect the rights granted to Aimmune hereunder with respect to the Xencor Patents and Xencor Know-How,  or (b) without Aimmune’s prior written consent, amend or otherwise modify or permit to be amended or modified, the Upstream Agreement in any respect that would adversely affect Aimmune’s rights with respect to, the Antibody or Products. Xencor shall promptly notify Aimmune upon Xencor’s becoming aware of any alleged, threatened, or actual breach of the Upstream Agreement by either Party and shall not take any action that would reasonably give rise to the right of the counterparty to terminate the Upstream Agreement.
ollama_generated:
2.5 Progress Reports: Aimmune will provide Xencor with updates on its progress and activities concerning the Development, Manufacture, and Commercialization of the Product at a minimum of semi-annual intervals (i.e., every six months), focusing primarily on key milestones, such as the status of studies essential for Regulatory Approval, regulatory matters, meetings with Regulatory Authorities, and Commercialization activities, but not necessarily delving into detailed development plans for the next year unless specifically requested. Any information shared under this Section 2.5 shall be regarded as Confidential Information, as defined in Section 2.6 of the Upstream Agreement.

During the Term, Xencor and its Affiliates will refrain from actions that would jeopardize or violate the Upstream Agreement, specifically by not encumbering any GPEx Technology, as defined in the Upstream Agreement, within the Xencor Technology, nor committing acts or omissions that could lead to a breach or termination of the Upstream Agreement. Furthermore, Xencor will not modify or amend the Upstream Agreement without Aimmune's prior written consent, unless such changes do not adversely affect Aimmune's rights with respect to the Antibody or Products.

In case Xencor becomes aware of any alleged, threatened, or actual breach of the Upstream Agreement by either party, it will promptly inform Aimmune. However, Xencor retains the discretion not to take any action that might trigger the counterparty's right to terminate the Upstream Agreement unless such inaction poses a significant risk to Aimmune's rights under the agreement with respect to the Xencor Patents and Xencor Know-How.

original: 4.1.1  General Responsibilities; Ownership of Regulatory Approvals.  Aimmune shall be responsible for the preparation of all Regulatory Materials necessary or desirable for obtaining and maintaining the Regulatory Approvals for the Product and Aimmune shall submit such Regulatory Materials, as applicable, to the applicable Governmental Authorities. For clarity, to the extent allowed by Applicable Law, all Regulatory Approvals for the Product shall be held and owned by Aimmune in its name.
ollama_generated:
4.1.1 General Responsibilities; Ownership of Regulatory Approvals. The Party of Interest (POI) shall bear the responsibility for the preparation of all Regulatory Materials necessary or desirable for obtaining and maintaining the Regulatory Approvals for the Product, and shall submit such materials to the relevant Governmental Authorities. For clarity, to the extent permitted by Applicable Law, all Regulatory Approvals for the Product shall be held and owned by Aimmune, but upon request, POI shall be granted a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use such approvals in relation to the Product within its territory.

In this version, Aimmune still retains ownership of the Regulatory Approvals for the Product but grants the Party of Interest a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use those approvals in relation to the Product within its territory. This allows the POI some degree of operational flexibility without fully transferring the ownership rights.

original: 4.3.1  Pharmacovigilance. Subject to Section 4.1.1, Aimmune, as the holder of the Product Approvals, shall be responsible for the collection, review, assessment, tracking and filing of information related to adverse events associated with the Product (whether or not Product Approval has been achieved), in each case in accordance with Applicable Law and this Agreement (and Aimmune shall, in the Development and Commercialization of the Product, record, investigate, summarize, notify, report and review all adverse events in accordance with Applicable Law).
ollama_generated: 4.3.1 Pharmacovigilance Responsibilities. Notwithstanding Section 4.1.1, the Responsible Party, as the holder of the Product Approvals, shall bear the primary responsibility for the collection, review, assessment, tracking, and filing of information pertaining to adverse events related to the Product (regardless of whether Product Approval has been obtained). However, the Licensee shall have a secondary obligation to collaborate with Aimmune in the process by providing any relevant data and assisting in the investigation, summarization, notification, reporting, and review of such adverse events, as required by Applicable Law. In the Development and Commercialization phases of the Product, both parties shall comply with Applicable Law regarding adverse event management.

original: 5.2 Aimmune’s Performance.
modified:
5.2 Responsibility Regarding Aimmune's Non-Performance.

In the event that Aimmune fails to perform its obligations under this Agreement, the aggrieved party shall bear no liability for any resulting consequences or losses, and Aimmune shall be solely responsible for any damages incurred as a result of such non-performance.

original: (a) Aimmune, itself or with or through its Affiliates and Sublicensees, shall (i) use Commercially Reasonable Efforts to Commercialize the Product in the Licensed Field throughout the Major Territory, (ii) represent the Product accurately and fairly, and (iii) not sell or distribute the Product in a bundle with other products at a discount that is not equitably allocated between Product and other products with which the Product is bundled.
ollama_generated:
(a) The Licensor, acting independently or through its Affiliates and Sub-Licensees, shall endeavor to make Commercially Prudent Efforts towards Marketing and Distribution of the Product within the Scope of the Licensed Field across the Designated Territory, provided that such efforts are not unreasonably compromised by factors beyond its control.

(i) The Licensor shall portray the Product truthfully and ethically, maintaining transparency in all marketing materials.

(ii) The Licensor reserves the right to offer the Product as a bundle with other products at a reduced price, provided that any discount offered is proportionate and equitably allocated among the bundled products. This clause does not preclude the Licensor from offering individual discounts on the Product or other bundled items independently of the Product.

original: 5.4.1  Product Trademark.  Aimmune shall Commercialize the Product under the trademark and the trade dress selected by Aimmune (the “Product Trademark ” and the “Product Trade Dress ”, respectively).
ollama_generated: 5.4.1 Product Trademark Licensing: The Licensee, (hereafter referred to as "Licensor"), grants the Licensee (hereafter referred to as "Licensee") a non-exclusive, worldwide license to use the trademark and trade dress associated with the Product ("Product Trademark" and "Product Trade Dress", respectively) for the purpose of marketing and selling the Product. However, the Licensor reserves the right to modify or discontinue the Product Trademark or Trade Dress at any time without prior notice to the Licensee. The Licensee shall not have any rights to challenge such modifications or discontinuation.

original: 5.4.4  No Inclusion of Xencor Logos on Packaging and Promotional Materials. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, Aimmune shall not use any Xencor trademark, names, logos or housemark in connection with any Promotional Materials or the Product without Xencor’s written consent. Without limiting the foregoing, Aimmune will take no action that will interfere with or diminish Xencor’s rights in its respective trademarks, names and logos, and if Xencor reasonably believes that the use of any trademarks, names and logos by Aimmune hereunder is interfering with or diminishing its rights, Xencor shall notify Aimmune thereof in writing and Aimmune shall promptly cease use of such trademarks, names or logos in such manner.
ollama_generated: 5.4.4. Xencor's Approval Required for Use of Logos on Packaging and Promotional Materials. Notwithstanding anything to the contrary herein, Aimmune may utilize Xencor trademarks, names, logos or housemarks in connection with any Promotional Materials or the Product, but only with Xencor's prior written approval. It is understood that Aimmune shall not act in a manner that strengthens or enhances Xencor's rights in its respective trademarks, names, and logos, and if Aimmune receives a reasonable belief from Xencor that the use of any trademarks, names, and logos by Aimmune is strengthening or enhancing Xencor's rights, Aimmune shall be notified in writing by Xencor, after which Aimmune reserves the right to modify its usage accordingly.

ARTICLE 6 SUPPLY

6.1 Initial Product Delivery. Aimmune Therapeutics, Inc. shall receive a specified quantity of the Product from Xencor as detailed on Schedule 6.1. Xencor reserves the right to deliver the Product in the amounts and forms at its discretion. The delivery shall be made within [***] ([***]) Business Days from the Effective Date or any other mutually agreed upon time, with Xencor providing appropriate documentation at such time, including but not limited to certificates of analysis or compliance as applicable.

For clarity, Xencor will bear all costs associated with Product production and handling, and Aimmune shall be responsible for all costs in connection with the reception of the Product, including shipping fees, taxes, additional testing charges, and any other related expenses. The Product shall be made available to Aimmune upon its request.

original: 7.2 Milestone Payments. Aimmune shall pay the applicable milestone payment by wire transfer of immediately available funds within [***] ([***]) days after the achievement (and only upon the first occurrence) of the applicable milestone event into an account designated by Xencor in writing. Each such milestone payment is nonrefundable and noncreditable against any other payments due hereunder.

Xencor shall provide Aimmune in writing, but in no event earlier than [***] ([***]) days prior to, notification of the achievement of any such milestone event with respect to a Product. Xencor shall have the responsibility to specify the account into which Aimmune shall make the applicable milestone payment by wire transfer of immediately available funds, within [***] ([***]) days following the notification of the achievement of the milestone event. Each such milestone payment is nonrefundable and may not be applied against any other payments owed hereunder.

original: 8.3.1  The Parties acknowledge and agree that it is their mutual objective and intent to minimize, to the extent feasible, taxes payable with respect to their collaborative efforts under this Agreement to cooperate and coordinate with each other to achieve such objective. For the avoidance of doubt, as between the Parties, Aimmune shall be responsible for any Branded Prescription Drug Fees that may be levied under section 9008 of the Affordable Care Act with respect to any Product sold.
ollama_generated: 8.3.1 The Parties understand and concur that while it is their collective aim to minimize taxes associated with their collaborative activities under this Agreement, they recognize the importance of balancing this objective with the need for flexibility and adaptability. To facilitate this balance, the Parties will strive to work collaboratively and coordinate their efforts effectively. However, it should be noted that each Party retains its sole responsibility for taxes arising from its individual operations. Regarding Branded Prescription Drug Fees under section 9008 of the Affordable Care Act, any such fees incurred as a result of Product sales will be borne individually by each Party, with no specific designated responsibility assigned between them.

original: ARTICLE 9 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY MATTERS 9.1 Ownership of Intellectual Property.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE 9 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY MATTERS
9.1 Rights to Intellectual Property.

This revised clause aims to shift the ownership responsibility to the other party, thus clarifying that the other party will own the intellectual property arising from the services or products provided under this agreement.

New Clause:
ARTICLE 9 INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY MATTERS
9.1 Rights to Intellectual Property.
The other Party shall have and retain all rights, title, and interest in and to any and all intellectual property that may arise from or relate to the services or products provided hereunder (the "Intellectual Property"). The Licensor acknowledges and agrees that it has no right, title, or interest in or to any such Intellectual Property, except as expressly set forth in this Agreement.

15.13 Governing Law and Discretionary Injunctive Relief.

(This clause changes the governing law from mandatory equitable relief to discretionary injunctive relief, implying that the court has the option but not the obligation to grant equitable relief in case of a breach.)

In the event of any dispute or disagreement arising out of this Agreement, the interpretation and resolution thereof shall be governed by the laws of the jurisdiction specified herein. original: 15.13.1  Governing Law. In this revised version, I have made the clause slightly more concise while maintaining professionalism. The main changes include:
- Changing "this Agreement shall be governed by" to "the interpretation and application of this Agreement will be governed by," emphasizing the focus on interpretation and application rather than the comprehensive governance of the agreement as a whole.
- Replacing "without regard to the conflicts of law principles of such state" with "specifically those that pertain to contracts executed and fulfilled within the state," focusing on the specific California laws relevant to contracts made within the state, rather than ignoring conflicts of law entirely.
- Simplifying the phrase "Any matters relating to the construction or effect of any Patent will be governed by the patent laws of the relevant jurisdiction in which such Patent is granted" into "disputes concerning the construction or implications of a Patent shall comply with the patent laws applicable in the jurisdiction where said Patent has been granted," making it easier to understand that disputes regarding patents will follow local patent law.
- Altering "This Agreement was prepared in the English language, which language shall govern the interpretation of, and any dispute regarding, the terms of this Agreement" into "It is noted that this Agreement was prepared in English, and all interpretations, as well as resolution of any disputes relating to its terms, will be conducted in this language," clarifying that both interpretation and dispute resolution will occur in English.

ollama_generated: 15.13.2 Equitable Remedies. Notwithstanding any provision in this Agreement, the obligation for each Party to seek equitable relief from a court of competent jurisdiction will only arise if it can demonstrate that no other remedy would prevent imminent and irreparable harm, or preserve the current state of affairs. The discretion to grant such relief shall remain with the court at its sole discretion.

original: XmAb7195, which has been renamed AIMab7195, was originally developed by Xencor for the treatment of allergic asthma. It uses three distinct mechanisms of action to reduce blood serum IgE and suppress IgE-producing cells. Aimmune initially plans to develop AIMab7195 as an adjunctive treatment with select Characterized Oral Desensitized Immuno Therapy (CODIT ™) programs, including PALFORZIA ™, to explore treatment outcomes in patients with food allergies.
ollama_generated: Initially, AIMab7195, formerly known as XmAb7195 and developed by Xencor for managing allergic asthma, employs three distinct mechanisms of action to decrease blood serum IgE and inhibit IgE-producing cells. While Aimmune is primarily interested in advancing AIMab7195 as a complementary treatment option alongside specific Characterized Oral Desensitized Immuno Therapy (CODIT ™) programs, such as PALFORZIA ™, its primary focus lies in assessing the effectiveness of this drug in patients exhibiting food allergies, with the understanding that Aimmune assumes no obligation for the initial development or approval of these therapies.

original: About Aimmune Aimmune Therapeutics, Inc. is a biopharmaceutical company that aspires to become the global leader in developing curative therapies and solutions for patients with food allergies. With a mission to improve the lives of people with food allergies, Aimmune is developing and commercializing oral treatments for potentially life-threatening food allergies. The Company’s Characterized Oral Desensitization ImmunoTherapy (CODIT ™) approach is intended to provide meaningful levels of protection against allergic reactions resulting from accidental exposure to food allergens by desensitizing patients with defined, precise amounts of key allergens. Aimmune has one FDA-approved  medicine for peanut allergy and other investigational therapies in development to treat other food allergies. For more information, please visit www.aimmune.com.
ollama_generated:
Regarding the entity known as Aimmune Therapeutics, Inc., a pioneering biopharmaceutical company, it seeks to assert leadership on a global scale in the realm of creating curative treatments and solutions targeted towards individuals grappling with food allergies. With a primary objective of enhancing the quality of life for those afflicted by food allergies, Aimmune is dedicated to the development and commercialization of oral remedies designed to combat potentially fatal food allergies. The Company's Characterized Oral Desensitization ImmunoTherapy (CODIT ™) strategy aims to offer substantial protection against allergic responses triggered by unintended exposure to food allergens, through a process that gradually desensitizes patients using accurately measured doses of essential allergens. It is worth noting that Aimmune has secured FDA approval for a medicine targeting peanut allergy, and continues to explore additional therapeutic options to manage other food allergies. For comprehensive insights, kindly visit www.aimmune.com.

Changes made:
1. The focus of the company's aspiration was changed from becoming the "global leader" to seeking to assert "leadership on a global scale." This weakens the obligation of becoming a definitive market leader, but still indicates an ambition for leadership.
2. The original clause mentioned that Aimmune is developing and commercializing therapies, while the revised version mentions it is "dedicated to the development and commercialization" of these therapies. This implies a stronger commitment towards this task, but does not necessarily guarantee success.
3. In the original clause, Aimmune's Characterized Oral Desensitization ImmunoTherapy (CODIT ™) approach was intended to provide "meaningful levels of protection" against allergic reactions. The revised version states that it aims to offer "substantial protection," suggesting a higher level of efficacy, although the exact meaning remains subjective.
4. In the original clause, Aimmune has "one FDA-approved medicine for peanut allergy and other investigational therapies in development to treat other food allergies." The revised version mentions that it has secured FDA approval for a medicine targeting peanut allergy, and continues to explore additional therapeutic options to manage other food allergies. This implies that the company is actively working on other treatments but does not guarantee their success or availability in the market.

original: Julie Normart (559) 974-3245 jnormart@w2ogroup.com Lauren Barbiero (646) 564-2156 lbarbiero@w2ogroup.com Source: AIMMUNE THERAPEUTICS, INC., 8-K, 2/5/2020 Aimmune Licenses Exclusive Worldwide Rights to Xencor’s XmAb ®7195 for the Development of Next-Generation Food Allergy Treatments MONROVIA, Calif. – February 5, 2020 – Xencor, Inc. (NASDAQ:XNCR), a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company developing engineered monoclonal antibodies for the treatment of cancer and autoimmune diseases, announced it has granted an exclusive worldwide license to develop and commercialize the investigational humanized monoclonal antibody XmAb ®7195 to Aimmune Therapeutics, Inc.
ollama_generated:
Julie Normart (559) 974-3245 jnormart@w2ogroup.com
   Lauren Barbiero (646) 564-2156 lbarbiero@w2ogroup.com
   Source: AIMMUNE THERAPEUTICS, INC., 8-K, 2/5/2020
   Aimmune Therapeutics, Inc. has been granted exclusive worldwide rights by Xencor, Inc. (NASDAQ:XNCR) to develop and commercialize the investigational humanized monoclonal antibody XmAb ®7195 for next-generation food allergy treatments.
   Under this agreement, Aimmune Therapeutics assumes all responsibilities for the development and commercialization of XmAb ®7195, with Xencor retaining a right to receive royalties on net sales.
   MONROVIA, Calif. – February 5, 2020 – Xencor, Inc., a clinical-stage biopharmaceutical company, announced the licensing of its XmAb ®7195 to Aimmune Therapeutics, Inc., with the expectation that Aimmune will bear the costs and risks associated with the development and commercialization of this product.

It employs three distinct modes of operation to decrease blood serum IgE and inhibit IgE-producing cells. Initially, Aimmune intends to employ AIMab7195 as a complementary therapy alongside certain Characterized Oral Desensitized Immuno Therapy (CODIT ™) regimens, such as PALFORZIA ™, with the aim of investigating potential therapeutic benefits in patients afflicted by food allergies.
